info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 10:39AM CDT until May 28 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Galveston and Harris.
* WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1038 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eastern League City, Galveston Causeway, Galveston Island West End, Texas City, Dickinson, La Marque, southern Seabrook, Hitchcock, Kemah, Galveston Pier 21, Bayou Vista, Clear Lake Shores, Jamaica Beach, Tiki Island, Offatts Bayou, Moody Gardens, Scholes Field, Schlitterbahn, San Leon and Pelican Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
